prompt_conds:
// constraint: cnt <= self.remaining() is true, with bound cnt == self.remaining()
// may panic: self.advance_unchecked(cnt) may panic in certain situations

codes: bytes_mut.resize(5, 0); // Set len to 5; cap is 10
// Check remaining is 5 and advancing by 5 should not panic
assert_eq!(bytes_mut.len(), 0); // length after advancing should be 0
bytes_mut.resize(5, 0); // Set len to 5; cap is 10
// Attempt to advance beyond the remaining length
bytes_mut.resize(5, 0); // Set len to 5; cap is 10
// Advancing by 0 should be a no-op
bytes_mut.resize(10, 0); // Set len to 10; cap is 10
assert_eq!(bytes_mut.len(), 0); // Length after advancing should be 0
// Initialize a BytesMut instance with a specific capacity and length
bytes_mut.set_len(5); // Set the length to 5, so remaining will be 5
// Test with cnt greater than the remaining bytes, which should cause a panic
let cnt = 6; // this is greater than the remaining capacity
assert!(result.is_err(), "Expected panic when advancing beyond remaining");
